sentence.Network_en: The vehicle that permitted both communication and acceptability was social revolution.
sentence.Network_cn: 既能实现交流又能被广为接受的手段就是社会革命。

sentence.Network_en: They have both behaved very badly and I am very hurt.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们俩都很不友善，让我非常难过。

sentence.Network_en: Featured are both his classics and his latest creations.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的经典作品和最新创作都很独特。

jx.jx_en_mean: benefit from two incompatible ways of thinking or behaving

lj.lj_ly: countries cannot have it both ways: the cost of a cleaner environment may sometimes be fewer jobs.
lj.lj_ls: 国家难以二者兼得，因为更加清洁的环境有时意味着较少的工作机会。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old Norse báthir

encyclopedia.content: 解释 形容词a. 1.两。..锛埗硷級,两个。..锛埗硷級 Both his eyes were severely burned. 他的双眼都严重烧伤了。 代词pron. 1.两者锛埗硷級;两个锛埗硷級;双方锛埗硷級 Why not buy both? 为什么不把两件都买下？ 副词ad. 1.并；又；两者皆 We like Amy and Phil both. 艾米和菲尔两个我们都喜欢。 连接词conj. 1.既。..且。..;...和。..都 The prospects bothexcited and worried me. 这前景即使我激动又令我忧虑。 用法 both是

entry.def: You use both when you are referring to two people or things and saying that something is true about each of them.

example.ex: She cried out in fear and flung both arms up to protect her face...
example.tran: 她吓得大叫，并且抡起双臂护住了自己的脸。

example.ex: Put both vegetables into a bowl and crush with a potato masher.
example.tran: 把这两样蔬菜都放进一个碗里，然后用捣土豆器把它们捣碎。

entry.def: You use the structure both...and when you are giving two facts or alternatives and emphasizing that each of them is true or possible.

example.ex: Now women work both before and after having their children...
example.tran: 现在妇女在生孩子前后都要去工作。

example.ex: Any such action would have to be approved by both American and Saudi leaders.
example.tran: 任何这样的行动都必须获得美国和沙特领导人双方的批准。

means.word_mean: 1. (used with count nouns) two considered together; the two;

auth_sentence.content: Both said Iraq did not have any active WMD.
auth_sentence.res_content: Both said Iraq did not have any active WMD.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Both said Iraq did not have any active WMD.

auth_sentence.content: Both were older than me and knew the game.
auth_sentence.res_content: Both were older than me and knew the game.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Both were older than me and knew the game.

auth_sentence.content: Both were big influences in their teams' wins.
auth_sentence.res_content: Both were big influences in their teams' wins.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Both were big influences in their teams' wins.

jushi.english: There are trees on both sides of the street.
